title: [BUG] Use Utils.NearlyEqual to compare floats
body:
## Bug

In [SKMatrix.cs](https://github.com/mono/SkiaSharp/blob/master/binding/Binding/SKMatrix.cs), there's code like this:

```
if (sx == 1 && sy == 1)
```

where `sx` and `sy` are floats.

`Utils.NearlyEqual` should be used for cases like this.

## Related

Also, in [SKColor.cs](https://github.com/mono/SkiaSharp/blob/master/binding/Binding/SKColor.cs), there's logic using `EPSILON = 0.001f`. `Utils.NearlyEqual` should be used too.

## Improvement

The `tolerance` argument of `Utils.NearlyEqual` should be set to `Utils.NearlyZero` by default, so that we don't have to pass it explicitly.
